main event: Observers reported seeing two stationary star-like objects in the sky over Bellport, Long Island, New York on the night of 29-30 Oct. 66.
interesting points: The objects were observed in different parts of the sky, with one in the NE and the other in the WNW., One observer identified one of the objects as the star Capella., The sighting was classified as an astronomical observation., There was no physical evidence left behind., The observer was reported to be intelligent, reliable, and credible.
sighted object: two star-like objects in the sky
